extent.value: in 5 record cartons, 2 manuscript boxes, and 9 oversize flat boxes

abstract.value: Julius Hemphill was a jazz composer and saxophone player who helped found the World Saxophone Quartet. He was a founder of the World Saxophone Quartet, the Julius Hemphill Quartet, and the Julius Hemphill Sextet. Hemphill's compositions and arrangements are noted for their combination of jazz, blues, and big-band sound. This collection consists of materials created and collected by Julius Hemphill from the mid-1960s to 1995 documenting Hemphill's career as a jazz composer and saxophonist. Materials in this collection include personal correspondence, original writings, ephemera, and manuscript music in various formats and stages of completion, including composition notebooks, scores, and parts to compositions. The manuscript music consists of compositions by Hemphill in his hand, compositions prepared by professional copyists, and arrangements and re-compositions of works by Hemphill of other composers. The collection also includes audio and video recordings of Hemphill's concert recordings, rehearsals, and  interviews of Hemphill from radio broadcasts.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Julius Hemphill Papers; MSS 542; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University.
Donated by Ursula Oppens in June and July 2018; the accession numbers associated with this gift are 2018.086 and 2018.112.

Julius Hemphill (1938-1995) was a jazz composer and saxophone player who helped found the World Saxophone Quartet. Hemphill was born in Fort Worth, Texas, and served in the United States Army for several years beginning in 1964. He began playing the clarinet, studying under John Carter, before learning saxophone. Hemphill later moved to St. Louis, Missouri and co-founded the Black Artists' Group (BAG) arts collective. He moved to New York City in the 1970s and became an active member of the city's jazz community, performing, recording, and teaching other musicians. He was a founder of the World Saxophone Quartet, the Julius Hemphill Quartet, and the Julius Hemphill Sextet. Hemphill's compositions and arrangements are noted for their combination of jazz, blues, and big-band sound.

This collection consists of materials created and collected by Julius Hemphill from the mid-1960s to 1995 documenting Hemphill's career as a jazz composer and saxophonist. Materials in this collection include personal correspondence, original writings, ephemera, and manuscript music in various formats and stages of completion, including composition notebooks, scores, and parts to compositions. The manuscript music consists of compositions by Hemphill in his hand, compositions prepared by professional copyists, and arrangements and re-compositions of works by Hemphill of other composers. The collection also includes audio and video recordings of Hemphill's concert recordings and rehearsals on audiocassette, reel-to-reel tapes, optical discs, VHS cassettes, and other formats. The audio recordings also include interviews of Hemphill from radio broadcasts.

dsc.value:
About Itselfcuid203961968-199511Scope and Contents

Guitar and cello part to a fourteen-measure composition, not in Hemphill's hand.

Abstraccuid203971968-199512Scope and Contents

Nineteen-page holograph score, ruled by hand, orchestrated for a jazz big band (five woodwinds, three trumpets, French horn, trombone, tuba, cello, bass, and percussion).

Affairs of the Heartcuid203981980-199513Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts to a work for saxophone quartet, orchestrated using woodwind doubles (soprano saxophone, flute, alto flute, bass clarinet).

After The Crowdcuid203991978-199514Scope and Contents

Five-page score photocopied from Sightation Notebook for a work for clarinet, French horn, saxophone, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

Ahmad the Terriblecuid204001986-199515Scope and Contents

Holograph concert score. Sixty-three-measure big-band arrangement of a Jack DeJohnette composition dedicated to pianist Ahmad Jamal. The folder also includes a holograph score for backgrounds during the solo section from measure 63, with detailed notes to the copyist in red ink. The melody of the original DeJohnette composition is not notated in the score.

Air Ringscuid204011968-199551Scope and Contents

Score in holograph for a work in two voices in treble and bass clef. There is a treble melody line, first designated for flute, but then suggested for soprano saxophone 8vb. The bass clef part is mostly single notes, though double stops may indicate a cello. There are also professionally copied soprano saxophone and bass parts, as well as parts in holograph for trumpet and guitar. The piece has an eight-bar intro, a twenty-bar A section, repeated, and an eight-bar bridge.

Anchorman - from "Last Supper"cuid204021990-199016Scope and Contents

Photocopy of professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (two soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone), based on material from "The Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

Anchorman - Theatrical Piececuid204031968-199517Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil of a piece for trumpet, two tenor saxophones, and bass clarinet. Score is in five lines, with meticulous phrase markings. Pages 4 and 5 (of 10 indicated) are missing. This piece was written for "Anchorman," a theatrical work in two acts by Paul Carter Harrison. Folder also includes a shorter score, marked "Act I," orchestrated for soprano saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, and bass clarinet.

Another Feelingcuid204041981-199552Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for a saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone). Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. This work is a slow chorale. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

Answer, Thecuid204051991-199553Scope and Contents

Transposed holograph score in pencil of a piece for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, baritone). Twenty-one measures. Hemphill wrote this work as a concert piece for the Julius Hemphill Saxophone Sextet; folder includes set of manuscript parts not in composer's hand and professionally copied parts use for the Sextet folio published by Subito Music.

Antecedentcuid204061977-199518Scope and Contents

Photocopy of "Fourth Blues: Uttered Flute" (a title in a decorative compartment) from Foran Notebook. An improvised flute solo, this piece was included on the album Blue Boyé (1977) under the title "Antecedent."

Ascensioncuid204071990-199554Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts to a piece for saxophone sextet (two sopranos, alto, two tenors, baritone) originally written for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

Astridcuid204081968-199519Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil for an up-tempo piece orchestrated for soprano saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. It is eighteen measures long with a written tag; the form is AABA + tag. Score is annotated with phone numbers and addresses for different individuals. Folder also includes professionally copied parts.

At Dr. King's Tablecuid204091990-1995110Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" for additional score and parts.

At Harmony - Small groupcuid204101984-1995111Scope and Contents

Holograph score for a work for alto saxophone and cello. Folder also includes a score in holograph for alto saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums, with detailed notes to the copyist, as well as a holograph alto saxophone part and a photocopy of a trumpet part from Trumpet Notebook.

At Harmony - Big band partscuid204111984-199555Scope and Contents

Full set of parts, professionally copied, on paper and transparency (paper vellum). Folder includes photocopies of parts (some originals in "Aggregated Parts").

At Harmony - Big band scorecuid204121984-1995112Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil as well as several photocopies.

Band Themecuid204131993-199556Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, baritone), titled "Backgrounds Band Theme." This piece was written for Julius Hemphill Sextet and was included in "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera." Parts were improvised during the tenor saxophone solo based on Jimmy Heath's "CTA" chord changes.

Basso / Pro Birdcuid204141968-199557Scope and Contents

Score with professionally-copied parts for a piece for flute, bass, and drums. Vellum and light-sensitive paper. Includes note for copyist that a guitar part should be made. The piece is eighteen measures long, with intro in 7/4 and main section in 2/2. Hemphill's notes indicate that a portion of this composition is used in the eighth movement of the "Drunk on God" suite. That movement is titled "Mailika" on the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988); it is titled "Maliaka: Drum / Woman" in Hemphill's score.

Bayou Sketchcuid204151977-1995113Scope and Contents

Four parts in holograph for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone). Included on the album Point of No Return (1977) as "Bajou Scetches" (and attributed to Hamiet Bluiett).

Big Bandcuid204161968-1995114Scope and Contents

Photocopy of a holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for a piece for big band (flute, alto saxophone / clarinet, alto/tenor saxophone, tenor/alto saxophone / flute, baritone saxophone / clarinet, bass clarinet / tenor saxophone / piccolo, French horn, trombone, tuba, cello, bass, and two percussion parts).

Big Drum Speaks, Thecuid204171988-1995115Scope and Contents

Parts in holograph for two guitars and bass (the instrumentation of Hemphill's JAH band), with chord symbols in a different hand. The parts are from a movement in the suite "Drunk on God," which appears on the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The movement is titled "Cosmic Country Boy" on the recording. See "Drunk on God" for parts and score, with title sometimes as "From Out of Nowhere: The Big Drum Speaks."

Big Footcuid204181977-1995116Scope and Contents

Holograph score and parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

Bimbo: The Elephantcuid204191977-1995117Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Sightation Notebook of a work for clarinet, trumpet, alto saxophone, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

Bitter Glory, A: Opening Songcuid204201994-1995118Scope and Contents

Two-page holograph score for a piece with a soprano or alto vocal line and unorchestrated accompaniment. In pencil and black ink with annotations in red ink; photocopies include further annotations. Several manuscript notebooks include parts for this piece for reeds/woodwinds (soprano and alto saxophone, clarinet, flute), brass (trumpet, French horn, trombone), cello, and bass. The piece is the "Opening Song" from music written for the theater piece "A Bitter Glory."

Blessed Quietnesscuid204211968-1995119Scope and Contents

Photocopy of parts in holograph for trumpet and tenor saxophone. Identified as page 2; page 1 not in folder.

Blues Countrycuid204221968-1995120Scope and Contents

Bass and guitar parts (each one page) in holograph of a twenty-one measure piece. Musik Hug Notebook has a score that includes a partial part for saxophone (included in folder as a photocopy).

Bordertown (San Antonio)cuid204231980-1995121Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil, with annotations in red ink, of a big-band arrangement dated 1980. There are further additions in Hemphill's hand, with background parts and harmonizations corresponding to the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The folder also includes a saxophone quartet arrangement (soprano, soprano/alto, bass clarinet / tenor saxophone, alto clarinet / baritone saxophone), as well as professionally copied parts; the first page (of two) for the bass clarinet / tenor saxophone part is missing. Folder includes a piano score in holograph for "Bordertown," with the the annotation "Good Boye Music ASCAP" on each page.

Bordertown - Big band parts Icuid204241980-1995122Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for big-band arrangement, reflecting some changes of instrumentation between 1980 and 1988 versions.

Bordertown - Big band parts IIcuid204251980-1995123Scope and Contents

Paper vellum parts and photocopies for the 1980 big-band arrangement.

Bumpkincuid204261968-1995124Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

Buster Beecuid204271978-1995125Scope and Contents

Folder includes Hemphill's alto saxophone part in holograph, as well as a photocopy from Schirmer's Notebook of the melody line for a duet for two alto saxophones. The holograph alto saxophone part includes some harmony notes to the melody found in Schirmer's Notebook.

BZcuid204281968-1995126Scope and Contents

Photocopy of incomplete score from Schirmer's Notebook for an enlarged big band ensemble (piccolo, flute, clarinet, alto, tenor and baritone saxophones, three trumpets, trombones, cello, bass, and percussion.) Score includes sketch for fourteen-measure intro, followed by twenty measures of a soprano saxophone part with some chord symbols.

C. M. E.cuid204291977-1995127Scope and Contents

Photocopy of a holograph score from Foran Notebook, for a work for flute, soprano saxophone, and alto saxophone, recorded through an overdub process on the album Blue Boyé (1977). The piece is titled "C.M.E." on the album and "Seventh (Roots)" in the notebook.

C (Those Blues) - Big band scorecuid204301974-1995128Scope and Contents

Big band arrangement in holograph score in pencil, with annotations in red ink, as performed in 1980. There is an additional page in holograph with material that was used for the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). Folder includes several photocopies of the big band score. This piece has been variously titled "C," "C (Those Blues)," and "C/Saw."

C (Those Blues) - Big band partscuid204311974-1995129Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for the big band arrangement, on paper vellum and paper.

Capetown Harvestcuid204321968-1995130Scope and Contents

Viola part in holograph, with title written in black felt-tip pen.

Changescuid204331968-1995131Scope and Contents

Photocopy of score, possibly in Hemphill's hand, with written instructions in Hemphill's hand, for flute, baritone saxophone, cello, and drums. The piece is forty-six measures long and is based on the main motive of Buddy Miles's composition "Changes." The piece may be incomplete, as there is a letter "D" following the fermata in measure 46.

Children's Song, The - Saxophone quartet versioncuid204341975-1995132Scope and Contents

Alto clarinet part, probably in Hamiett Bluiett's hand, which transposes the clarinet part from a work orchestrated for two flutes, clarinet, and tenor saxophone; a photocopy of the holograph score for from Foran Notebook is included here. Folder also includes a trombone part by a professional copyist on paper vellum, indicating performances by a different ensemble.

Children's Song, The - Sextet versioncuid204351990-1995133Scope and Contents

One-page holograph score for saxophone sextet (three altos, two tenors, baritone) and voice (dancers onstage), in which Hemphill harmonizes the opening melody of his saxophone quartet of the same title. The folder also includes professionally copied parts for soprano, two altos, tenor, and baritone saxophone. (A second tenor part may be missing.) Folder includes photocopy of holograph score, as well as a different orchestration for alto saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, trombone, baritone saxophone, and bass. This was the final movement of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." See "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land" for score and parts.

Choo Choocuid204361975-1995134Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook and several sets of photocopied parts, also in composer's hand, of a piece for saxophone quartet (soprano, alto, tenor, baritone).

Circlescuid204371968-1995135Scope and Contents

One-page holograph score for an unfinished piece for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, baritone). In pencil and black ink with annotations in red ink. Nine-bar intro, eight-bar A section, and an eight-bar B section consisting only of baritone saxophone melody.

Cole, Bill: Compositions arranged by Hemphillcuid204381986-1995136Scope and Contents

Holograph score of arrangements for an octet (two woodwinds, trumpet, tuba, cello, bass, and two percussionists) of seven compositions by Bill Cole. In pencil and black ink with further annotations in red and blue ink, fifteen pages in total. Piece titles: "To Sow Is To Reap," "Live with Humble Man /Spirit," "Tormenter," "Beat Drum / Man Man," "One Man's Hatred / Destiny," "Don't Go to Bed With Your Roof Afire," "Man Woman Snake Dead." Folder includes envelope in which scores were mailed from Cole to Hemphill.

Connectionscuid204391980-1995137Scope and Contents

Parts in holograph of a piece for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, baritone). The piece is a 34-measure slow chorale.

Cool Redcuid204401987-199558Scope and Contents

Holograph score for a piece for saxophone quartet (two sopranos, tenor, baritone). Ballad in 3/4 time.

Coralcuid204411968-1995138Scope and Contents

Two-page holograph score in black ink for a piece orchestrated for flute, trumpet, and cello. Folder includes holograph parts for cello and trumpet. The piece is twelve measures long, with a four-bar vamp at the end.

Countrysidecuid204421977-1995139Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook of a piece entitled "Fifth Blues," orchestrated for flute, soprano saxophone, and alto saxophone. This piece appears on the album Blue Boyé (1977) with the title "Countryside."

Crystalcuid204431968-1995140Scope and Contents

One-page holograph score, eleven measures long, along with photocopy of score that includes additional tempo marking in composer's hand, of a composition for string quartet (violin, viola, cello, double bass). Instruction for "cymball roll" suggests the piece originally included percussion.

Cyclic Affaircuid204441968-1995141Scope and Contents

Cello part in holograph.

Dar El Sudancuid204451977-1977142Scope and Contents

Four parts in holograph of piece for saxophone quartet (two soprano, tenor, and baritone).

Dear Friendcuid204461968-1995143Scope and Contents

Score in holograph of piece for three instruments, likely alto saxophone, cello, and an unknown third instrument. The score is fifteen measures long, with three unidentified parts; lowest line indicates "arco" at times. There are two parts in Hemphill's hand for alto saxophone and cello, though they do not correspond precisely to the lower two staves in the full score.

Dimples: The Fat Lady on Paradecuid204471978-1995144Scope and Contents

Photocopy of score in composer's hand from Sightation Notebook for clarinet, soprano saxophone, trumpet, bass, and drums. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

Dirty Rowcuid204481977-1995145Scope and Contents

Photocopy of score in composer's hand from Foran Notebook, recorded as an overdub composition on the album Blue Boyé (1977). In the notebook, it is titled "Fifth Blues." Score consists of several twelve-tone rows with transpositions.

Dogon A.D. - Small Groupcuid204491972-1995146Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Kawaida Notebook, entitled "Original Dogon A.D," for alto saxophone, trumpet, vibraphone, and drums. Various parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, cello, bass, tuba, bass clarinet, and guitar, reflecting different group arrangements. Some parts are in holograph, others professionally copied, and others in different hands.

Dogon A.D. - Big Bandcuid204501980-1995147Scope and Contents

Score in holograph for big-band arrangement of "Dogon A.D.", orchestrated for five saxophones, trumpet, French horn, trombone, tuba, vibraphone, bass, and drums. There is a complete set of professionally copied parts on paper vellum and paper for this twelve-piece arrangement, as well as a part in holograph for guitar, with annotation in composer's hand. See large-scale work "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" for an arrangement with added strings.

Downstairscuid204511968-1995148Scope and Contents

Cello part in holograph for a seventy-measure piece.

Dreamscuid204521968-1995149Scope and Contents

Score in holograph for one unidentified instrument, apparently torn from manuscript book. Tempo marking is "Very slow" and the piece is divided into "Part I" and "Part II."

Dream / Schemecuid204531978-1995150Scope and Contents

Photocopies of parts in composer's hand for two flutes, soprano and tenor saxophone. Holograph full score appears in Foran Notebook.

Dungcuid204541978-1995151Scope and Contents

Various parts for clarinet, alto saxophone, trumpet, tuba, bass, drums, and guitar, some in holograph, others professionally copied. There are two incomplete scores, both indicating a quintet arrangement, one in holograph with lines for tuba, bass, and drums, the other a photocopy from Sightation Notebook for clarinet, alto saxophone, and trumpet. Sightation Notebook includes an ordered list of the suite of compositions with circus-themed titles, from which this piece is drawn.

East / West Cyclescuid204551968-1995152Scope and Contents

Photocopy of trumpet part in composer's hand. Sixteen-measure melody.

Ebonycuid204561986-199559Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil, with annotations in composer's hand in red ink, for big-band (five saxophones, five trumpets, four trombones, guitar, keyboard, bass, and drums). Arrangement of a composition by Jack DeJohnette. Folder includes second score in holograph for two background sections.

Exoticacuid204571968-1995153Scope and Contents

Photocopy of page from Foran Notebook, not in composer's hand. Part for cello with instructions for improvisation. (May not be Hemphill composition.)

Fanfare No. 5cuid204581968-1995154Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for alto saxophone, tenor saxophone, and bass. From a sequence of pieces in Schirmer's Notebook for similar instrumentation.

Fat Mancuid204591991-1995510Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil and blue ink for saxophone sextet (soprano, two altos, two tenors, and baritone). Score bears the titles "Cornered" and "Fat Man." The first page of the score has been cut in half. Folder includes holograph parts with annotations by members of the sextet, including instructions for improvisation on Hemphill's first alto part, as well as photocopies of professionally copied parts.

Fat Webcuid204601968-1995155Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Schirmer's Notebook for alto saxophone, tenor saxophone, and bass.

Fifteencuid204611991-1995156Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone, cello, and drums. The page also bears the title "One Groove," and the second page of the score features the composition "Sixteen."

First Eventcuid204621978-1995157Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone, guitar, bass, and drums. Professionally copied parts for alto saxophone, bass, and drums, with note in composer's hand indicating some parts to be performed ad lib.

Five Chord Studcuid204631993-1995158Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone sextet, three alto, two tenor, and baritone sax. Holograph parts. Some parts bear alternative title, "Shorty."

Fixationcuid204641981-1995159Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (soprano, two tenor, and baritone). Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. Percussion sections indicated in parts. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

Fixed Signscuid204651976-1986160Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for saxophone quartet (two soprano saxophones, alto clarinet, and bass clarinet). Parts reflect specific instrumentation used by the World Saxophone Quartet.

Flaircuid204661981-1995161Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for two flutes, alto flute, and bass clarinet. Each part has the number "11" at top of page, indicating order in a series of works. Composition is part of a suite entitled "Wind/Rhythms" written for World Saxophone Quartet's collaboration with Max Roach's M'Boom. See "Wind/Rhythms" for full score.

Flat-Out Jump Suitecuid204671980-1995162Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph short score; holograph parts for trumpet, tenor saxophone, and cello. There is also an alto-saxophone transposition of the trumpet part in Marty Ehrlich's hand. This piece is included on the album Flat Out Jump Suite (1980) under the title "Body."

Floatcuid204681988-1995163Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Musik Hug Notebook, as well as holograph parts for trumpet, guitar, and bass, which differ from the score. Score fragment with indication "After the original Float," indicating later extension of the work. This piece was arranged and titled "Floating" for the "Drunk on God" suite.

Floppy / Blued Upcuid204691991-1995511Scope and Contents

Holograph score in pencil for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). Includes three sets of parts: photocopies of holograph parts except first alto saxophone part (see Aggregated Parts for originals), manuscript parts not in composer's hand, and photocopies of professionally copied parts used for the published sextet collection.

Flushcuid204701990-1995512Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone sextet (soprano, two alto, two tenor, and baritone). Includes manuscript parts likely in the hand of a sextet member, and photocopies of professionally copied parts used for the published sextet collection.

Fly Dancecuid204711968-1995164Scope and Contents

Fragmentary holograph score in pencil. Of the four staves, one contains a 24-measure melody for flute. "Tenor" is written at the top of the page.

For Billie - Scorescuid204721980-1995513Scope and Contents

Four holograph scores representing different arrangements and stages of composition. One-page holograph score with melody for alto saxophone in pencil and chords in red ink. Thirteen-page concert score for big band (five saxophones with flute doubling, trumpet, flugelhorn, trombone and baritone horn, and rhythm section). There is also a four-page extension of this big-band arrangement, with flute parts and annotations in pencil and red ink. Two-page score (transposed) for alto saxophone, trumpet, tenor saxophone, French horn, guitar, bass, and percussion.

For Billie - Partscuid204731980-1995514Scope and Contents

Complete set of professionally copied parts for big band (1980 version) on paper vellum. Additional professionally copied parts for two trumpets, trombone, and two guitars. There are also two guitar parts, one in holograph, one professionally copied, as well as an alto saxophone part with additional chordal writing.

Fourcuid204741968-1995165Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score from Foran Notebook, for alto saxophone, trumpet, bass, and drums. See "One Two Three Four" for the other movements from this four-part suite. Folder includes various parts for alto saxophone, trumpet, guitar, cello, and bass, some in holograph, several of these photocopied from parts containing multiple pieces (see "Aggregated Parts").

Functionscuid204751990-1995166Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone quartet (alto, two tenor, and baritone) in blue and black ink. Four parts in manuscript, likely in Marty Ehrlich's hand, with additional annotations in various hands. One part includes chord notations in Hemphill's hand.

Funny Papercuid204761981-1995167Scope and Contents

Holograph parts in black ink for saxophone quartet (two altos, tenor, and baritone).

G Songcuid204771977-1995168Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph short score from Musik Hug Notebook. The version of the piece on the album Raw Materials and Residuals (1977) differs in structure from this score. Holograph part for tenor saxophone, which resembles material in "A Bitter Glory" Notebooks.

Georgia Bluecuid204781984-1995169Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone quartet (solo alto, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone). Holograph parts for quartet version for alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone. This piece was arranged for saxophone sextet (solo alto, soprano, alto, two tenor, and baritone) for the large-scale work "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera." Folder contains professionally copied parts for the sextet version. See "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera" for additional score and parts.

Glidecuid204791991-1995111Scope and Contents

Holograph score (transposing) for saxophone sextet (three alto, two tenor, and baritone). Folder includes manuscript parts likely in the hand of a sextet member, and photocopies of professionally copied parts.

Hand-Packedcuid204801980-1995170Scope and Contents

Holograph score for trumpet, tenor saxophone, cello, and percussion, including notes for copyist. Photocopies of professionally copied parts (originals in "Aggregated Parts").

Hard Blues, The - Score and small group partscuid204811972-1995112Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score for alto saxophone, trumpet, and cello/bass from Chiaroscuro Notebook. Holograph part for cello (with instructions for drums), as well as professionally copied parts for trumpet and alto saxophone. Folder includes photocopy of holograph score for big-band arrangement (two soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophones, two trumpets, trombone, tuba, vibraphone, bass, and drums), which premiered in 1980. Also includes one-page original holograph score with additional background parts. Folder includes parts for saxophone sextet arrangement, based on big-band parts. See also "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

Hard Blues, The - Big band partscuid204821972-1995113Scope and Contents

Complete set of professionally copied parts in paper vellum and paper, as well as photocopies, for big-band arrangement.

Wind/Rhythmscuid205921981-198143Scope and Contents

Holograph score for saxophone quartet (switching among soprano, alto, tenor, and baritone saxophone, and flute, alto flute, and bass clarinet) with notes for percussion. Suite with five movements: "Fixation," "Flair," "Ji-Ji Tune," "Another Feeling," and "Stick." See "Stick" and "Ji-Ji Tune" for additional parts. Composition written for collaboration with Max Roach and M'Boom. Folder includes two pages with instructions for performance.

Would Boogiecuid205931970-1980268Scope and Contents

Holograph parts for trumpet, alto saxophone, guitar, and bass, some titled "Wood Boogie."

Zulicuid205941968-1995269Scope and Contents

Holograph parts for trumpet, tenor saxophone, and cello. Photocopy of holograph score for three unidentified instruments.

Aggregated Partscuid205951968-1995270Scope and Contents

Parts for multiple compositions, with more than one composition per sheet, in a variety of hands though many in holograph.

Untitled Scores and Partscuid205961968-199544Scope and Contents

Parts and scores, many in holograph, with unidentified or fragmentary compositions. Outside of folder includes notes in Marty Ehrlich's hand.

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: I. The Cabincuid205971990-199545Scope and Contents

Holograph score for "The Cabin," the first part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Cabin Opener"; "Harry"; "Liza - Tearful Farewell"; "George"; "Slave Dance"; "Chloe"; "Tom"; "Men's Chase / Haley's Dance"; "Tom's Goodbye"; "Boat Music"; "Slave's Walk"; "Lucy"; "St. Clair Family"; "Eva and Tom"; "Dixie Dance"; "Death of Eva"; "Auction"; "Tom's Whipping"; "Ghosts"; "Retrograde"; "Fanfare for Lincoln."

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: II. Eliza on the Icecuid205981990-199546Scope and Contents

Holograph score for "Eliza on the Ice," the second part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Knee Play"; "Eliza on the Ice"; "Aint' I a Woman"; "Elevator Music"; "Betsy"; "Prayer Music"; "End of Betsy"; "Fanfare for Maya"; "Soft Shoe"; "Maya"; "Prayer Music."

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: III. The Promised Landcuid205991990-199547Scope and Contents

Holograph score for "The Promised Land," the third part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "At Dr. King's Table"; "Step Dance"; "Dixie Dance"; "Football"; "Ascension"; "Crossformation"; "Opening (Hymn)"; "Three-Step."

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land: IV. The Last Suppercuid206001990-199548Scope and Contents

Holograph score for "The Last Supper," the fourth part of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land." This large-scale composition was written for saxophone sextet, with extensive switching by each player. Individual movements include "Arthur"; "Trans"; "Men's Trio"; "Ringmere"; "Ringmere Canon"; "Four Saints"; "Spiritual Chairs"; "Lenny"; "The Children's Song."

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land - Assorted Partscuid206011990-199545Scope and Contents

Various parts for saxophone sextet for the different movements of "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land. Many in pencil, in different hands. Some parts include cut-out photocopies of scores, assembled into performance order. Several parts identify the name of the musician in the original performance.

Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land - Photocopy scorescuid206021990-1995141Scope and Contents

Various photocopies of scores for "Last Supper at Uncle Tom's Cabin / The Promised Land."

Drunk on Godcuid206031988-1995142Scope and Contents

Holograph score of "Drunk on God" suite for big band (five saxophones, two trumpets, two French horns, two trombones, two guitars, drums, and bass), written for the album Julius Hemphill Big Band (1988). The movements (titled differently on the recording) are "Nago: Testament"; "Maliaka: Drum/Woman"; "Pigskin" or "Motion as the Lang"; "Float"; "Bob Scene: KC Line"; "Anchorman"; "From Out of Nowhere: The Big Drum Speaks." Several movements exist as independent compositions.

Drunk on God - Parts Icuid206041988-1995143Scope and Contents

Set of professionally copied parts for several movements of the "Drunk on God" suite ("Nago: Testament," "Maliaka: Drum/Woman," "Motion as the Lang"/"Pigskin," and "Float"). Includes annotations in various hands.

Drunk on God - Parts IIcuid206051988-1995144Scope and Contents

Set of professionally copied parts for several movements of the "Drunk on God" suite ("Anchorman," "The Big Drum Speaks," and "Bob Scene - KC Line."). Includes annotations in various hands.

Ralph Ellison's Long Tonguecuid206061978-1995145Scope and Contents

Holograph score with multiple movements from the theatrical work "Ralph Ellison's Long Tongue." Instrumentation includes alto and tenor saxophone, trumpet, French horn, and cello. Individual movements are "Sketch 1," "Sketch 2," Sketch 3," "Sketch 4," and "Sir Preacher." Folder includes holograph parts for two additional movements: "Carnival Barker," for which there is an alto saxophone part, and "Orator," for which there are parts for trumpet, cello, and soprano saxophone. These parts include settings of text based on the novel by Ralph Ellison, Invisible Man (1952).

Water Music for Woodwinds - Partscuid206071976-1995151Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for seven instrumentalists playing various woodwinds. The parts are identified by the names of the original musicians, with annotations in various hands and photocopied parts attached with tape.

Water Music for Woodwinds - Materials for Editioncuid206081976-2003152Scope and Contents

Photocopies of the professionally copied parts for seven woodwind players, with further annotations in red ink. Folder includes two printouts of computer-engraved full score, with annotations in red pencil and ink by Marty Ehrlich, dated January 2003. Additional pages contain photocopies of hand-written notes on performance sequence.

Plan B - Working Materialscuid206091993-1995153Scope and Contents

Manuscript scores, likely in Christopher Bankey's hand, for an arrangement for orchestra of several Hemphill compositions. Includes several pages of short score, with notes on instrumentation, as well as two pagse of full score with measure numbers and notes for insertion. The individual movements of "Plan B" are "Border Town," "What I Know Now," and "Dogon A.D."

Plan B - Printed Scorecuid206101993-1995154Scope and Contents

Printout of computer-engraved full score for "Plan B," an arrangement for orchestra by Christopher Bankey of three Hemphill compositions, "Border Town," "What I Know Now," and "Dogon A.D." The score is printed as two pages per 11"x17" sheet, fifty-three sheets in total.

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Sextet Partscuid206111985-1990155Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for the saxophone sextet contained in "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera."

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - String Partscuid206121985-199031Scope and Contents

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Winds/Brass Partscuid206131985-199032Scope and Contents

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Rhythm Section Partscuid206141985-199033Scope and Contents

Professionally copied parts for piano, bass, drumset, and percussion, for "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera."

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Photocopy of Holograph scorecuid206151985-1990161Scope and Contents

Photocopy of holograph score for "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera," as well as performance instructions on loose sheets in various hands.

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Assorted photocopies of scorecuid206161985-1990162Scope and Contents

Assorted photocopies of full score (holograph and conductor's score) for "Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera," some with annotations in various hands.

Long Tongues: A Saxophone Opera - Holograph and Conductor's Scorecuid206171985-1990171Scope and Contents

Holograph full score, in pencil and blue, black, and red ink. Conductor's score (oversize), cleanly copied in pencil, with annotations in black and red ink by unknown hand. Individual sections include "Georgia Blue," "Band Theme," "Danse A La Midi," "A Prayer Type Line," "Sketch I," "Sketch II," "Sketch III," "Sketch IV," "Overture," "Bop Scene: KC Line," "Otis' Groove," "Mask Dance," "R and B," "Dogon A.D.," "For Andrew," "Soulo."
